summary: Email correspondence regarding the preparation and transfer of financial documents related to the US v. Epstein investigation. An Assistant U.S. Attorney requests a contractor to burn specific folders containing subpoena returns from American Express and Deutsche Bank to a disc for delivery to a Special Agent.

persons.name: Hamilton
persons.context: Contractor who possesses discs and is asked to burn specific investigation folders for delivery.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Intended recipient of the disc containing financial documents from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email requesting the preparation and delivery of financial documents related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is directing the contractor Hamilton to prepare and deliver investigation materials.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney is arranging for financial documents to be delivered to the Special Agent.

events.title: Request for Financial Document Transfer
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the burning of specific folders containing subpoena returns from American Express and Deutsche Bank to a disc for delivery to a Special Agent.

Usa.doj.gov\ clouaNYS StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618 InvestigationVt 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena Returns\ Deutsche Bank
keyFacts: Financial documents from American Express and Deutsche Bank were subpoenaed as part of the US v. Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
The document transfer was coordinated between an Assistant U.S. Attorney, a contractor, and an FBI Special Agent in July 2019.
The email indicates an active investigation involving financial records was ongoing in the Southern District of New York in 2019.
